html:
To all developers using SoundCloudâ€™s public API â€” weâ€™re introducing an important change that will affect how you reference resources like tracks, playlists, users and comments.

ğŸ§  Whatâ€™s Changing?

SoundCloudâ€™s resource identifiers (id) have always been numeric. As the platform grows, some of these numbers will soon exceed the maximum value of a 32-bit integer. To ensure forward compatibility and prevent broken integrations, weâ€™re deprecating the id field and introducing a new field: urn â€” a string-based unique identifier.

ğŸš¨ As a result, the id field in API responses is now deprecated. We strongly recommend switching to the new urn field â€” a string-based unique identifier.

ğŸ—“ï¸ Timeline

Effective immediately: The id field is deprecated.

By June 30th, 2025: Clients must switch to using the urn field.

After June 30th: Services relying on the id field may experience degraded behavior:

  • Partial data loss (e.g., new resources may not appear)
  • Full API response failures in some cases

âœ… What You Should Do

Update your integrations to rely on the urn field instead of the id. The urn is a stable, unique string that will not be affected by integer limitations.

ğŸ’¡ Example Changes

Hereâ€™s what the change looks like for different resource types:

ğŸµ Track

Before:

  {
    "id": 12345678,
    "title": "My Track"
  }

After:

  {
    "urn": "soundcloud:tracks:12345678",
    "title": "My Track"
  }

ğŸ“ Playlist

Before:

{
  "id": 98765432,
  "title": "My Playlist"
}

After:

{
  "urn": "soundcloud:playlists:98765432",
  "title": "My Playlist"
}

ğŸ’¬ Comment

Before:

  {
    "id": 87654321,
    "body": "Great track!"
  }

After:

  {
    "urn": "soundcloud:comments:87654321",
    "body": "Great track!"
  }

Accessing resources via URN

All the endpoints are ready to take either id or urn!

  • Before: https://api.soundcloud.com/tracks/12345678
  • After: https://api.soundcloud.com/tracks/soundcloud:tracks:12345678

We recommend to move always URN going forward. Accessing via id is deprecated immediately!

ğŸ“¦ Bonus Tip

To extract the numeric part of the URN for legacy support or internal mapping, you can parse the URN string â€” but we strongly discourage from doing, isntead treat the URN as the primary key moving forward.

ğŸ’¬ Need Help?

If you have questions or run into issues, please reach out through our developer support channels, open issues on GitHub or check the updated documentation here.

Letâ€™s make this transition smooth â€” thanks for building with us â¤ï¸
